column4: I require assistance reinstalling GRUB. My damn Windows installation somehow removed it and now only boots in Windows but I know my other partitions are still there and functional cause I've looked in GParted's livecd. I tried a system rescue disk and GRUB encountered an I/O error. Help. I don't wanna have to go through this crap.
boot the live cd - in a terminal do "sudo grub" then enter the correct root and setup partition data
what partition is your linux setup on
of course you can check it on the live cd - and G: drive has no relation to drive/partition numbers
how many hard disks do you have
ok so sudo grub then "root (hd0,0)" then "setup (hd0)
did you note down the grub commands I gave you
do you have a prompt that says "GRUB>"
when did I tell you to restart
if you want help - listen - if you want to do your own stupid thing - please do so
I didn't see that as I have flood turned off)
